explanation: the act of accepting someone into an institution, organization, etc.; the right to enter a place or to join an institution
sentence: She's applied for admission to law school.
sentence_gap: She's applied for _________ to law school.

sentence: The barn of the other side of the farmyard is full of hay bales.
sentence_gap: The ____ of the other side of the farmyard is full of hay bales.

explanation: a feeling of extreme worry, sadness, or pain
sentence: Many of the horses were showing signs of distress at the end of the race.
sentence_gap: Many of the horses were showing signs of ________ at the end of the race.

sentence: Three minutes into the game, Jackson limped off the pitch with a serious ankle injury.
sentence_gap: Three minutes into the game, Jackson ______ off the pitch with a serious ankle injury.

explanation: an angry disagreement between two or more people or groups
sentence: They had a bitter quarrel about/over some money three years ago and they haven't spoken to each other since.
sentence_gap: They had a bitter _______ about/over some money three years ago and they haven't spoken to each other since.

explanation: to free a person or place of something unwanted or harmful
sentence: In the city, it is hard to rid a building permanently of pests.
sentence_gap: In the city, it is hard to ___ a building permanently of pests.

explanation: to remove something from a container using a spoon, your curved hands, etc
sentence: She scooped the ice cream into the dishes.
sentence_gap: She _______ the ice cream into the dishes.

sentence: She got some eggs out and heated a pan on the stove.
sentence_gap: She got some eggs out and heated a pan on the _____.

explanation: you, used when speaking to one person; old use

sentence: People throughout the country are out of work.
sentence_gap: People __________ the country are out of work.

explanation: a device that opens and closes to control the flow of liquids or gases, or a similar structure in the heart and the veins that controls the flow of blood
sentence: It was a weak heart valve that caused her death.
sentence_gap: It was a weak heart _____ that caused her death.

explanation: an object that causes a feeling of great surprise and admiration
sentence: We spent a week visiting the wonders of Ancient Greek civilization.
sentence_gap: We spent a week visiting the _______ of Ancient Greek civilization.
